Tonight a very important event transpired, and not many people understand why it had to happen the way it did. Looking back on it, maybe they'll discover it, but perhaps it'll remain an undiscovered truth by the masses. Taker was defeated by Brock Lesnar at Wrestlmania 30, bringing an end to his undefeated Streak of Wrestlemania wins.

Now, it's not just that his Streak had to end that is important, but that someone like Brock Lesnar had to take it from him. Both of these things are very important to realize, and I hope that after reading this you'll understand why I have come to this particular conclusion. Before that, however, I'll make a proper introduction into who I am.

I'm a wrestling fan born in the late 70s and started watching in the 80s. Naturally, this makes me a Hulkamaniac. I watched the commercials, I tried to keep up with as many of the shows that I could, I watched Hulk Hogan's Rock 'n' Wrestling. I knew all the names, I knew almost every signature move and how to perform them. I never got into backyard wrestling, but I did practice several moves on my friends to show off; because of such, I actually believedd in the stage fights that were happening, since the moves that I did really did hurt.

Over the years, my enthusiasm towards wrestling never waned. Yes, I found out about all the tricks of the trade, how a vast majoirty of the moves were choreographed and the refs were the ones directing the traffic during the improv that was happening in the ring. I saw the rise and fall of legends, the death of many of may heroes. I went from watching WWF to WCW in the 90s, rooting them on during the Monday Night Wars, and occasionally being able to watch ECW when I could figure out where they were hiding on the television.

After WCW was defeated by WWE, I occasionally kept up with their brand, but the Monday Night Wars had definitely created an impact upon me when it came to watching them. My heroes had taken a severe backseat to the established roster, and I didn't appreciate how some of them were being treated. Sure, today several had gone on to make names for themselves within WWE, but it was a hard fight to do so. But, I knew all the names of those on the roster, and learned the various different storylines so that I could enjoy parts of what I was watching.

That's when I came to understand that there was a wrestler named The Undertaker who had been scripted to never lose a single match when it came to Wrestlemania. This wasn't an unique concept for me; over in WCw, Goldberg waas scripted into never having lost a single matching since his debut (No, I don't acknowledge the one loss that he supposedly had during the Taser Fight, basically WCW's version of the Montreal Screwjob). I was impressed that they had managed to keep the story going for as long as it hadd been, and also that they were able to keep the audience tied to their target regardless that everyone knew in the back of their mind that Taker was going to win when he got into that ring.

Around 2009, I found another wrestling organization. Now, I knew that ROH, AWA, NJW, AAA, etc existed, I just had no real way to tune into them since I was stationed overseas and didn't have access to television. iTunes, however, allowed me to subscribe to this new organization and keep up to date on their shows. This is how I came to start watching TNA; and how I learned to enjoy wrestling once more.

One of my biggest heroes of wrestling from the 90s on had always been Sting. I was glad that he never joined WWE while several of his locker room buddies were. I watched d the interviews that Sting had regarding WWE and agreed that they would have destroyed his image if he had jumped over to WWE when everything was going down. By now, those that have been reading through the dirt sheets see where I'm going with all of this, but stick with me, I'm getting there.

Every year, Sting resigned with TNA/Impact Wrestling and kept going, but there was always that persistent rumor, a rumor that I always hoped was still a rumor because of my distaste with WWE. However, this year Sting decided that he wasn't going to continue signing with Impact Wresting and let his contract lapse. Also this year, Taker and Lesnar started showing signs of the storyline that would lead to the result of Wrestlemania 30.

Taker was destined to lose. Even if you haven't seen the match between Lesnar and Taker during WM30, you know that Taker is getting ready to retire. Mark is 49 years old, well into the sidelines and backstage development age. However, WWE management has never been able to find someone that could take the Taker's Streak and break it with such force that the people would genuinely HATE the person whom was responsible as Taker got later into the years. CM Punk even developed a rabid following, and the destruction of Taker's Streak then wouldn't have garnered the same push as someone like Lesnar.

Meanwhile, Sting is being approached by WWE now that he's a Free Agent, and he's been overheard at Q&A panels talking about wanting to wrestle against Taker before he retires.

So, why was it necessary for Taker to lose this year? Because neither Taker nor Sting (age 55) are ready to retire, leave their boots in the middle of the ring, and help out the new blood. If Taker had faced Sting when he still had his Streak, there would be confusion from the fans. Do you sign Sting and have him face against Taker for one last fight and lose because.. The Streak? Hell no.. Sting (like Taker) is a wrestling icon, there's a reason he's been nicknamed The Icon. Well, then do you have Sting defeat Taker and have him end The Streak before retiring? Hell no.. That's worse than what everyone is carrying on about with Lesnar defeating Taker.

So, you have to put them into a position where the only thing on the line, is a Win/Lose.. perhaps not even that. But, you also want to put them on the biggest stage that you can.. Wrestlemania.

So, put a contract in front of Sting letting him know that he gets to take on Taker as well as other financial selling points, and you have yourself the biggest money grab in a long time.

WRESTLEMANIA 31:: Taker vs Sting.. Clash of the Legends.

So, it's been awhile since I've posted anything... as such, I'll give you the low-down on what's happening. This mostly only will be understood by fellow Cammies, but I'll try to incorporate some non-Cam stuff that's going on.

Now, it's just a matter of a smooth transition from no VSTs for three of the four venues that we have, to three new VSTs... or possibly two VSTs with one of them running two venues. I hope to avoid this, but I've already been informed that if it's necessary, one of them will run for two of the venues. Fortunately, Jared is staying on as the Lost VST.

2. New PC for Requiem - After several months of dealing with the approval process, several weeks ago I got my Childer of the Morrigan approved. It's actually rather humorous to watch the local Humanity 7 vamps deal with this Humanity 3 guy that just doesn't see things in the same light as they do. Something that I've recently discovered, though, is that I might actually end up taking a few dots of Obfuscate although I was hesitant to take anything past One due to this lack of interest in hiding that he's a monster as per Mask of Tranquility. However, Mask of Tranquility may be suspended as it's not immediately activated power. Nice....

3. SSEC - For those that know me & my job, SSEC is the name of it. For those that don't know, I'm a field engineer/network technician who travels the US to various different sites and physically sets up networks for wireless access points that are used for hand-held scanners in some businesses. Usually I'm out and about for weeks on end while I'm driving to a site and then staying out there before driving back. These trips can go out as far as Pennsylvania while driving. The company feels that if you will be hitting several sites, you'll just drive out to the first one, deal with it, drive out to the next one and eventually get back to Arizona. If you're heading out as far as Pennsylvania without hitting any other job sites, they'll fly you out then... However, from Arizona to Colorado/Wyoming without a rush, is a drive. Anywho, I've recently found out from my boss that he appreciates the work that I do when I'm in the office so much that he would rather I stick around than go out on jobs. So.... more than likely, I'll be office-bound more than I have been... No skin of my nose, really.

4. The Reset(tm) - Back to Cam stuff here. So The Reset(tm) is happening in less than a month now. They've supplied plotkits for all the venues that are available within The Camarilla, and unfortunately people aren't too happy with them. I realize that they didn't have much time to work on these plotkits that they've put out, but I can't say that I'm all too satisfied with them, myself. I'm going to be running them in the Domain, because it's been put out by Global, but I'm also going to do my best to make the players happy with the end story, regardless if I have to do a little bit of tweaking on the parts of the plotkits prior to the endstory. It's only fair to the players.

5. Movie Reviews - Hey, those long-time readers of mine out there know that I used to do movie reviews here. Know what? I'm bringing them back. Expect most of the reviews to be of movies that have been out on DVD/VHS for awhile, but that's because I don't have much time/money to go out every weekend to see the new things. If there is a movie that you would really like for me to watch, just shoot me an email to: reyvinnyte@yahoo.com with the subject of PLEASE REVIEW THIS MOVIE! I don't care if I would never think to watch it, I'm willing to put myself through hell to save you from the possible anguish. Also, those familiar with my review styles will get a laugh out of seeing possibly horrifically done movies reviewed properly.. And I don't mean the censored Roger & Ebert shit, I mean the in your face, oh my fuckin' God you gotta be kidding me... what the fuck is that?! type of review.

That's it for now kiddies... see you on the flip side!

So today is April the 1st... Also known as April Fools' Day. There are two holidays that I just love when they finally come around, Halloween & April Fools' Day. I'm a child at heart, and have strove to continue to live the life that my Grandparents set before me... Live each day as if you were no older than you were when you first enjoyed life.

However, there are some people that do not share in my enthusiasm for such holidays, much the pity to them.... Here's an example.

So, our esteemed US NST within The Camarilla had decided, at 12:01am on April 1st, to send from his personal email address (not his Cam Officer address) an email to the SE Region that decreed the upcoming Reset Plotkit was that everything was a dream. Those that were a part of SERE '01 would remember that was the actual plot for the C/A game held on the second night... It was all a dream.

After the message got spread out from the SE Region, people started popping up, calling for poor Clint's head... stating that he should get a DA for it, even get removed as the US NST. Meanwhile, several of us were congratulating Clint on a well-played prank. Heck, when I first saw it I knew it had to be a prank, if for no other reason that Clint Hauser is the NST, not the PL: Reset... so if a plotkit got handed out, it would have come from David, himself, or supported by David, this was obviously not the case. As such, a prank indeed... and since it was my favorite holiday, definitely was a prank, and a well-played one. Unfortunately, there are enough people who care little for holidays like this and are easily offended by the nature of the prank.

Now, before you respond here, I've got two things to say:

1.) Please note that in my Profile, that I've made it clear that I often will make comments that will offend people. If you are offended by my words, stop reading... it's really very simple. I will put things behind cuts within my initial post if I feel that they will immediately offend people, but if you venture into my responses page and get offended there, please don't try coming at me for that... I will do my best to remain civil, but I am not making any guarantees.

2.) I understand that there is a Reset about to happen. I realize that he didn't immediately state that it was an April Fools' Day prank. I know that you might not have known about the reference to SERE '01 in the original email. But, again, this was an email that Clint sent to the SE Regional List from his PERSONAL email address not his USNST email address.

Boredom strikes the workplace as suddenly the only female in the shop looks over at one of us three guys and says...

"What would you do if you had boobs??"

After her surprise at the guy's inability to give her a specific thing, she turned to me who was just coming around the corner after hearing a break in the silence (I didn't hear her ask the question initially, so she had to ask it again when I said "huh?" to her "How 'bout you, Ambrose?")

I chewed on my lower lip, rolled my eyes upward and pretended to think on the matter (really trying to figure out which one to give her for the first item). Defaulting to... "I reallyyyyyyy can't even begin to start down that list of things." Which caused her to get a confused look on her face.

Satisfied with my ability to stump her yet again, I walked off... By the time that I came back she was looking over at one of the guys with the comment of "I couldn't just look at it for the entire day, though... I mean, it's not as good looking." As I looked over at the guy in question, I deduced (with a good deal of success) that he had informed her that he'd probably spend a good deal of the day just admiring the boobs that he developed since he had the mind of a guy with the body of a woman, and then had asked her if she wouldn't do the same thing if she had suddenly developed the body of a man with the mind of a woman.

So, now that I'm equally bored, I'm gonna ask the same thing of our avid readers here... If you woke to suddenly find yourself in the opposite gender's body, but still retained your own mind... How would you react?? Lord knows, I would be hard pressed to get out of a shower if it had one of those massage heads ;)

So I'm having to throw away a plotkit that I've been working on for the past month into the trash... Why? Because Hawaii had an earthquake.

Now let me elaborate on that.

When Columbine had it's school shooting, people stopped running "Trenchcoat Mafia" groups in respect for the travesty that happened.

When 9/11 happened, we re-evaluated associating any terrorist events with IC actions.

And when a 6.5 earthquake hit Hawaii a week ago that did little structural damage and no fatalities or injuries, plotkits get thrown into the dumpster if they reference earthquakes that would equal or rival that.

Guess I'll have to start thinking about not running any stories that involve snow storms just incase another blizzard hits the US that causes people to get stuck at home? Or typhoons just for those several storms a year that run through the oceanic area?

It's a good thing this isn't the Old Cam anymore where we had to deal with things like Thunderwyrms in Werewolf: the Apocalypse who could create apparently natural disasters that could easily knock California off it's platform. Because then you'd need to make sure that all the STs out there put their big bad weather guys on the bench.

But, hey, maybe it was worse than I thought it was... Maybe there's ongoing coverage for this earthquake like there was for the Tsunami that hit India, or when Katrina hit Louisiana. So, I went to CNN.com and looked for the terrible earthquake that hit Hawaii. Hrmmm.... nothing on the splash page on the front page. How 'bout the world's top news stories... Wow... nothing here about the Hawaii earthquake. Hell, rice in Japan is getting more notice than this big bad earthquake that I'm destroying a plotkit for. Oh shit... better take a look through my plotkits to make sure that I'm not dealing with food shortage...

So... Hawaii has a 6.5 that doesn't get any further coverage a week or so after the fact and I'm being told to scrap a plotkit in respect for the devastation that hit the nation. Pah.. I'm giving more respect than the nation that I'm supposed to be respecting is giving.. Gawd this ranks right up there with "political correctness" in terms of my distaste.

Oh, and BTW... no CoC here... it's not a Cammie LJ, but an LJ owned by a Cammie.

So, I finally decide to update this thing with all the different updates that I have been meaning to put here and just seem to get side-tracked from on the way.

-=-=-

Self-Understanding

Well over a week ago, I had a revelation regarding something that I had thought I had understood about myself. Obviously, the old saying of "Learn something new every day." doesn't exclude personal understanding. For those that know me well, you already know that I tend to be shy around women, extremely so if it's a beautiful woman (see an earlier entry regarding this matter). However, I have since learned that there was more to it than that.

It appears that I have a problem with large groups of people. When there are far too many people for me to handle, I tend to clam up and have an interest to get away. It's easy to understand why I've not noticed this prior to the incident that happened over a week ago, as whenever I was with a large group, I wasn't me.. I mean, I was me, but I wasn't Jeremy. I was nestled within the protective environment of game (with The Cam), or too busy to notice it. But when there are almost three times as many people as I'm used to walking around in my work center, and I realize that I've been sitting on the countertop rocking back and forth slightly, moving whenever anyone moved into the small space I had found for myself, I came to understand this yet unobserved part of me.

Fun stuff, eh?

-=-=-

Finally got my blue card!!!! What does that mean, it means that I don't have Cinderella Liberty anymore when in Yokosuka. It means that even though I still tend to make it back to the ship before midnight, I have the option to be irresponsible and stay out even later... like til 1210 or something.. lol... Weeee...

Supernatural & Smallville

If you've not seen Supernatural yet and you enjoyed the first couple seasons of The X-Files... then you're missing out. You really gotta get your hands on Supernatural. I've watched the entire first season and now I'm upset... because of the fact that the second season isn't out yet...

I've also managed to finally get my hands on Season 5 of Smallville and finish watching that... and now I'm doubly upset... but not as upset as I am with the closer of Supernatural...that just pissed me off... but anywho I watched Smallville and I can't wait for season 6 to be finished so that I can get a hold of that one.

-=-=-

Movies....

Heard that one of you devout readers out there went and saw X-Men3... and agree with me that it stinks. I haven't seen past the closing credits yet, so I'm not sure what everyone keeps talking about with watching until the end of the closing credits... if someone wants to fill me in there, please do.

If you're a big fan of Mel Brooks, look around for The Mel Brooks Collection which is in stores now. Seven great Mel Brooks DVDs for under $100. Blazing Saddles, High Anxiety, History of the World Part 1, Robin Hood: Men in Tights, To Be or Not to Be, Silent Movie, The Twelve Chairs.

Also grabbed a copy of Silent Hill... Really wish they hadn't used the Silent Hill 2 ending, but otherwise was a good movie. I've been hearing gossip that they're thinking about releasing a Silent Hill 2 movie, and with four games out there for the Silent Hill series, that's not too surprising. Also hitting theatres soon.... Saw III.

So here we go... What was so terrible about the movie that I couldn't stand it... In a review style format

X-Men brought you the directors belief on the origin of Rogue as well as Bobby (Ice Man) and Pyro... Really not all that delighted, but it was still a good X-Men type movie.

X-Men 2 brought you the directors belief on parts of Logan's past as well as Nightcrawler's introduction. The only real redeming part of the movie was that Nightcrawler went his seperate way and they didn't try throwing him in as a permanent character. Meanwhile, Bobby & Rogue are starting to develop a relationship that was never there in either the comic book or the cartoon series. Lady Deathstryke is also shown, in a very poor fashion and killed off way too easily. Also the mastermind behind the Hellfire Club was brought into the movie in a poor fashion and I'm glad that they didn't really expand more upon that than they did. The believed death of Jean Gray made things look up for the approach of X-Men 3 as the fans knew they were going to introduce Phoenix. Rumors started escalating that they were even going to show the Sentinels.

X-Men 3, just never deserved to be put to paper, it should have been torched, but then I have already made my opinion on that clear and you haven't even received your review. My apologies.

Like I said, I haven't seen all of it yet, and I really doubt that I ever will. However, here's a review on what I did see, feel free to add to it...

From the previews we were shown that the government had found a new mutant whose mutant ability was to remove the mutant ability from those that got near him. Then using his genetics, the government was able to create a "cure" to the mutant "disease." Many mutants had decided that this next step would prevent humans from harassing them, and flocked to centers where the cure was being handed out. We are shown that Jean Gray does, indeed, return in this movie, as well as the appearance of Angel & Beast.

Kelsey Graham was a good choice for Beast, his personality was definitely quite spot on from what I saw in the movie, however aside from the movements during the battle at the end of the movie, it just didn't sell as Beast. Angel... Well, I really didn't see him in what I saw, except near the end where he flies over the park, so I can't say whether the character potrayal was correct.

Bobby & Rogue continue their relationship, however with Rogue being unable to physically interact with Bobby, he starts to develop an interest in another female character, Kitty Pryde. So now you've got a love triangle that never really even comes close to happening anywhere... Why? I guess the director believed that it would pull the female audience in to put some drama into the already self-destructing movie.

Juggernaut is put on display as well... But when he's shown to the audience I'm sitting there trying to figure out who the guy from the Adult BDSM Store is supposed to be... Wait... that's fuckin' Juggernaut?!? OMFG!!

Jean Gray faces off against Professor X... Not too bad.. Until she does the same thing that she did to Scott... EXPLODES THE POOR BASTARD. That's right... Jean Gray has developed the psychic ability to make people explode into dozens of little pieces.. No blood or anything.. Uh-huh... So now she's offed Scott AND Professor X.. Wait, doesn't Professor X end up going crazy in the comic series and turn into Onslaught to tear the X-Men apart before they finally stop him??? Nope, guess he's dead now.

Calysto bows knee to Magneto as the Morlocks leave from the sewers of New York to organize up in the wilderness under the power of Magneto... Umm.. yeah.

Jean Gray decides to follow Magneto as well... Riiiiight, I guess if they got rid of the Hellfire Club, she can't be a part of that, so we'll just get the next best thing.

Bobby & Pyro have a kick ass fight, and they finally show Bobby the way he's supposed to be, covered completely in ice.

Jean Gray goes ballistic after they use the cure on Magneto and remove his powers from him for good, and destroys all mutant kind in the area (namely all the morlocks and some humans on the Alcatraz Island where they're holding the mutant kid who cures all). However, Logan, with his UBER regen power merely reforms his body parts that get destroyed after each blast from Jean & kills her himself.

Rogue goes and gets the cure given to her as is shown when she actually physically touches Bobby and tells him that everything is going to be right now.

And then right before the credits roll we are taken to a park where people sit around playing chess, and see a now saddened Magneto sitting at a bench with a chessboard in front of him, he gazes down at the board and reaches out his hand for a few seconds before the piece in front of him shakes a little...

Yeah... there's your review... For the death of a comic... If I see another X-Men movie launch from that director I'm gonna find me the next plane to Hollywood and tear him a new one.

Peace. I'll write again when I calm down from the viewing.</lj-cut>
